Posts.Content: Hi Hattie I wanted to reassure you as well that the biopsy will be fine. I have had a needle biopsy (with no local anaesthetic ) and a core biopsy with a local. For me, the needle one was more painful but not horrendous, and only felt a scratch with the core one. I have to have another one on Friday too, and like you, I'm waiting for a proper diagnosis. Good luck with your last weeks/months of uni, try not to stress too much.....easier said than done though!! Hope all goes well with your biopsy and results  Xx
Posts.Title: 22yo terrified of core biopsy - and, well, everything

Posts.Content: Hi all, I've been a bit quiet on here lately, been nervous about my op, but also have been able to have my holiday first. So after finding my lumpy area 5 months ago, and going through biopsys, scans etc, I am finally having my mastectomy and immediate diep reconstruction .  I am glad that they are finally removing the DCIS , but nervous incase it has started to become invasive after all these months. It is such a big op and will be 6-8 hours, that's really scary, but the 2 surgeons are lovely and I have faith in them that they will do a good job. I have been reading comments from some ladies that have had the same op and that has helped. I keep saying to myself that by this time tomorrow it will all be over and I will be back on the ward and starting the long recovery! Oh my goodness, I feel sick ha ha Xx
Posts.Title: Big op tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Thank you Debs for the good wishes. Definitely one step at time.  I'm trying to keep positive. Everything will be fine and I'll get through it, like so many women before me. I love that rainbows make you smile . I shall go to bed tonight thinking of what makes me smile too Take care Ange Xx
Posts.Title: Big op tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Thanks sue. I'm just off to bed now, don't know how well I'll sleep. Got to be up at 5.30 ! Xx
Posts.Title: Big op tomorrow!

Posts.Content: Thank you Karen, I will indeed !!  Xx
